feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to capture and display comments by dimension combination in SAC (Optimized View limitation)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am working on a Consolidations reporting use case in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).
We require that for each intersection of Segment × Account × Version × Period (or MonthFrom/MonthTo) we should be able to:

  1. View existing comments linked to that dimension combination.

  2. Allow users to enter new comments (for example, reasons for variance).

What I tried so far:

  • Created an external comments file (CSV) with fields:
    DriverKey, Segment, Account, Version, MonthFrom, MonthTo, Driver_Text, Owner, Status, Changed_By, Changed_On.

  • Imported this into SAC as a separate model (Drivers_External).

  • Linked it to my Facts model (Consolidated, Base, Eliminations) via DriverKey using Data Relationships.

  • The expectation was: when I select a row in Facts, the corresponding comment for that combination should appear in a second table (Drivers), and users could also input/update commentary.

The issue:

  • In Optimized View mode, the linked dimension relationship is not supported, so the Drivers table does not filter by the selected fact row.

  • This prevents us from displaying comments side by side with facts, or providing an input mechanism for users to add/update reasons for variance.

My questions:

  1. What is the recommended design pattern in SAC to both view and input comments tied to specific dimension combinations?

  2. Can this be achieved via Text Accounts, Data Point Comments, or Analytic Applications?

  3. Has anyone implemented a hybrid approach (external driver model + facts model) successfully, with user entry enabled, despite Optimized View restrictions?

Any guidance, examples, or references would be very helpful.

entry.title: SAC Previous Year(Measure) by dynamic filter
entry.content:
Hi, I'm doing my project but i have some issues.


Among them, my question is how can i calculate previous year amount based on dynamic filter.

For example, If i choice '202503' then previous year measure will show '202403' amount.(and it is not YTD, just month amount)

Even sum of clicked month.
'202503, 202504, 202505' -> '202403, 202404, 202405'


I tried so many way but i can't find any fit way.

Also, I don't want show a date dimension in table.

Did anybody has a idea on this, please share it!
Thank you so much.

entry.title: Dynamic Query for Daily Sales in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are facing a request from a client to retrieve daily sales into SAC and to provide the ability for manual adjustments. To achieve this, we have created a planning model with daily granularity and are using the standard CDS view GLAccountBalanceFlow with the following filters:

  • Company code
  • Fiscal year: 2025
  • GL account type: PLCHANING, PLOPENING, PLENDING
  • Ledger: 0L

    However, we encountered two issues:

    1. The query never completes.
    2. We haven’t found a dynamic way to set the posting date without hardcoding it, but instead using a dynamic date, e.g., system date.

Has anyone faced a similar issue? If so, how did you resolve it? Any advice or direction would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help!

BR, thx

entry.title: Just Ask: Account dimension not detected on SAC Overview page for one model
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m encountering an issue in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where Just Ask does not recognize the Account dimension on the Overview page. As a result, I’m unable to define synonyms for account members—an essential requirement for my use case. (Screenshots attached.)

For context:

  • The Account dimension in this model is a public dimension.
  • Other models that use the same public Account dimension do allow me to add synonyms for account members. (Screenshots attached.)

Could you help me identify potential causes for this behavior?

I’m happy to provide any additional details that would be helpful.
Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Displaying the Amount for the Initial Data Point in the Chart (202501)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I need to display the amount for the initial point in my chart, specifically for period 202501. So far, the only way I’ve found to make it appear is by disabling the “Avoid data label overlapping” option in the Data Label settings.

However, the issue is that when I leave this option disabled and add more metrics to the chart, the data labels no longer behave as expected—they start overlapping or displaying inconsistently.

I’ve attached an image to illustrate the situation. Has anyone faced a similar issue or found a better workaround?

Thanks in advance!

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: After executing the data action, the manually entered parameter values remain cached for the session
entry.content:
Hi,

We’re working with a scenario where a data action prompt is prefilled based on table selection. The input controls are dynamically assigned via script according to the selected table row. This setup works well—as long as the user doesn’t manually change the prompt values.

However, once a user manually modifies the parameter values in the data action prompt (f.e. different cost center) and executes the action, those manually entered values persist for the session. After that, the prompt no longer reflects updates from the input controls, even though the script continues assigning the correct values.

While resetting the story via Edit > Reset resolves the issue, it’s not a viable option due to long loading times.

Could you please confirm if this is a known behavior? And is there any recommended workaround—ideally one that doesn’t require rebuilding the prompt dialog from scratch?

Many thanks,
Fabian

entry.title: SAC View mode - Has the View Mode layout been updated?
entry.content:
I’ve noticed a change in how a story opens in View mode:

  • When I first open the story, View mode looks the same as before (image attached below). 

  • If I switch to Edit mode and then back to View, it now opens in a new layout.

  • Previously, that new window opened in the previous version of the viewer, but over the last few days it opens in the later/newer version instead.

Is this behavior part of a recent update?
If not, is there a tenant- or story-level setting that controls which viewer version is used when returning to View mode (and/or whether it opens in a new window)? Any pointers to the exact setting or documentation would be appreciated.

Thanks!

<Before>

 

<After>

entry.title: Sap Analytics Cloud - table inside section have vertical scroll bar
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), we're trying to replicate the page layout of a Crystal Report using sections. When we put a large table inside a section, we can't export the entire table to a PDF because the "Auto Size and Page Table Vertically" option is grayed out. Only the visible part of the table is exported.

How can we disable the vertical scroll bar within a section to ensure the full table is exported to PDF?

Regards,

Animikh

Any idea what is happening?

entry.title: SAC date filter in story: how to get most current date from data source
entry.content:
Hi, i'm a fairly new SAC user and have the following question regarding date filters:

We use HANA Live Connections to consume Calculation Views in SAC stories. In some of our data sources, the current date does not match the system date. For example, in September (now), the most recent date in the data source is July. In SAC Stories, we would like to implement it so that when users open or refresh the story, this date from the data source is always displayed. In other words, in an SAC story, this current date should always be interpreted as the most recent date and carried forward when new data for a new current date is available. However, users should still have the option to adjust this date via a (story) filter in order to analyze past values as well.
Until now we weren't able to get this working properly. Is there any solution to this task/problem?

entry.content: Hi Any idea why many have got this mail alert, any action required ? Thanks

entry.title: Issue with IF() syntax in SAC Grid Table formula
entry.content:
Hi ,

I'm trying to use an IF() statement in a Grid Table formula in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to avoid division by zero when calculating variance. The platform accepts a simple formula like:

(F3 - E3) / E3

But when I try to use:

IF(E3 = 0, NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

I get a syntax error. I’ve tested other variations like:

  • IF(E3 <> 0, (F3 - E3) / E3, NULL)
  • IF(ISNULL(E3), NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

None of them work in the Grid Table context.

ps : I'm not using a calculated measure or story formula—this is directly in a Grid Table cell.

Is IF() not supported in Grid Table formulas?\ Where can I find official documentation listing supported functions in this context?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Data Action
entry.content:
Hello All,

Could anyone please help me with this? I’m reviewing the standard code for the data action Delta Planning in CAPEX. While executing the first part of the code using trace points/debugging, I’m unable to understand the logic behind the value that appears in the AMOUNT_DELTA measure (750).

Can someone assist me in figuring out how this value is being derived?

this is the logic I am debugging in standard code of calculating depreciation delta amount 

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Set Configurations Definitions for the Advanced Formulas.
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_ALL_COMPANY_CODE], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//FOREACH [d/Date]
// Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF
